thread.title: Renewable Energy Surpasses Other Sources as Dominant Power in China's Plateau Region by 2023
thread.title_full: Renewable Energy Surpasses Other Sources as Dominant Power in China's Plateau Region by 2023

author: @shanghaiist
title: Renewable Energy Surpasses Other Sources as Dominant Power in China's Plateau Region by 2023
text: - Qinghai province’s total installed clean energy capacity hit 51.07 million kilowatts in 2023, marking a 23.77 percent increase compared to the previous year, adding 9.8 million kilowatts of new capacity. - For the first time, new energy power generation in Qinghai exceeded hydropower generation, making it the largest power source in the province. - The Qinghai-Tibet Plateau region is abundant in natural resources, serving as the origin for major rivers like the Yangtze, Yellow, and Lancang, and is rich in water, solar, and wind power. “` Northwest China’s Qinghai province has seen a significant surge in its clean energy capacity, with the total installed capacity reaching 51.07 million kilowatts in 2023. This information comes from the provincial branch of State Grid, highlighting a substantial growth in the region’s renewable energy infrastructure. Impressive Growth in Clean Energy - 23.77 percent increase in installed clean energy capacity compared to the end of 2022. - 9.8 million kilowatts of new clean energy capacity added recently. Renewable Energy Milestones - New energy power generation outpaced hydropower for the first time in 2023. - New energy has become the leading source of power in the province. Qinghai’s Natural Advantages - Strategic location on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau. - Abundance of water, solar, and wind power resources. - Proximity to the headwaters of major rivers such as the Yangtze, Yellow, and Lancang.
